ids_info.name: distribution_sources
ids_info.description: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions.

distribution_sources/source.documentation: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions.

distribution_sources/source/process.documentation: Set of processes (NBI units, fusion reactions, ...) that provide the source. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier").

distribution_sources/source/process/type.documentation: Process type. index=1 for NBI; index=2 for nuclear reaction (reaction unspecified); index=3 for nuclear reaction: T(d,n)4He [D+T->He4+n]; index=4 for nuclear reaction: He3(d,p)4He [He3+D->He4+p]; index=5 for nuclear reaction: D(d,p)T [D+D->T+p]; index=6 for nuclear reaction: D(d,n)3He [D+D->He3+n]; index=7 for runaway processes. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within process container: Set of processes (NBI units, fusion reactions, ...) that provide the source.

options.name: nuclear
options.description: Source from nuclear reaction (reaction type unspecified)

distribution_sources/source/process/type.documentation: Short string identifier. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within process container: Set of processes (NBI units, fusion reactions, ...) that provide the source. Within type container: Process type. index=1 for NBI; index=2 for nuclear reaction (reaction unspecified); index=3 for nuclear reaction: T(d,n)4He [D+T->He4+n]; index=4 for nuclear reaction: He3(d,p)4He [He3+D->He4+p]; index=5 for nuclear reaction: D(d,p)T [D+D->T+p]; index=6 for nuclear reaction: D(d,n)3He [D+D->He3+n]; index=7 for runaway processes.

Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within process container: Set of processes (NBI units, fusion reactions, ...) that provide the source. Within type container: Process type. index=1 for NBI; index=2 for nuclear reaction (reaction unspecified); index=3 for nuclear reaction: T(d,n)4He [D+T->He4+n]; index=4 for nuclear reaction: He3(d,p)4He [He3+D->He4+p]; index=5 for nuclear reaction: D(d,p)T [D+D->T+p]; index=6 for nuclear reaction: D(d,n)3He [D+D->He3+n]; index=7 for runaway processes.

distribution_sources/source/process/reac.documentation: For nuclear reaction source, energy of the reactants. index = 0 for a sum over all energies; index = 1 for thermal-thermal; index = 2 for beam-beam; index = 3 for beam-thermal. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within process container: Set of processes (NBI units, fusion reactions, ...) that provide the source.

A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within process container: Set of processes (NBI units, fusion reactions, ...) that provide the source. Within reactant_energy container: For nuclear reaction source, energy of the reactants. index = 0 for a sum over all energies; index = 1 for thermal-thermal; index = 2 for beam-beam; index = 3 for beam-thermal.

distribution_sources/source/process/nbi_.documentation: For NBI source, energy of the accelerated species considered. index = 0 for a sum over all energies; index = 1 for full energiy; index = 2 for half energy; index = 3 for third energy. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within process container: Set of processes (NBI units, fusion reactions, ...) that provide the source.

Within process container: Set of processes (NBI units, fusion reactions, ...) that provide the source. Within nbi_energy container: For NBI source, energy of the accelerated species considered. index = 0 for a sum over all energies; index = 1 for full energiy; index = 2 for half energy; index = 3 for third energy.

Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within process container: Set of processes (NBI units, fusion reactions, ...) that provide the source. Within nbi_energy container: For NBI source, energy of the accelerated species considered. index = 0 for a sum over all energies; index = 1 for full energiy; index = 2 for half energy; index = 3 for third energy.

Index of the NBI unit considered. Refers to the "unit" array of the NBI IDS. 0 means sum over all NBI units. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within process container: Set of processes (NBI units, fusion reactions, ...) that provide the source.

Index of the NBI beamlets group considered. Refers to the "unit/beamlets_group" array of the NBI IDS. 0 means sum over all beamlets groups. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within process container: Set of processes (NBI units, fusion reactions, ...) that provide the source.

distribution_sources/source/gyro_type.documentation: Defines how to interpret the spatial coordinates: 1 = given at the actual particle birth point; 2 =given at the gyro centre of the birth point. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier").

distribution_sources/source/species.documentation: Species injected or consumed by this source/sink. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier").

distribution_sources/source/species/type.documentation: Species type. index=1 for electron; index=2 for ion species in a single/average state (refer to ion structure); index=3 for ion species in a particular state (refer to ion/state structure);  index=4 for neutral species in a single/average state (refer to neutral structure); index=5 for neutral species in a particular state (refer to neutral/state structure);  index=6 for neutron; index=7 for photon. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within species container: Species injected or consumed by this source/sink.

options.name: ion
options.description: Ion species in a single/average state; refer to ion-structure

options.name: ion_state
options.description: Ion species in a particular state; refer to ion/state-structure

options.name: neutral
options.description: Neutral species in a single/average state; refer to neutral-structure

options.name: neutral_state
options.description: Neutral species in a particular state; refer to neutral/state-structure

distribution_sources/source/species/ion.documentation: Description of the ion or neutral species, used if type/index = 2 or 3. Within state container: State of the species (energy, excitation, ...).

Vibrational mode of this state, e.g. "A_g". Need to define, or adopt a standard nomenclature. distribution_sources/source/profiles_1d.documentation: Source radial profiles (flux surface averaged quantities) for various time slices. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within profiles_1d container: Source radial profiles (flux surface averaged quantities) for various time slices.

Normalized toroidal flux coordinate. The normalizing value for rho_tor_norm, is the toroidal flux coordinate at the equilibrium boundary (LCFS or 99.x % of the LCFS in case of a fixed boundary equilibium calculation, see time_slice/boundary/b_flux_pol_norm in the equilibrium IDS). Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within profiles_1d container: Source radial profiles (flux surface averaged quantities) for various time slices. Within grid container: Radial grid.

Toroidal flux coordinate = sqrt(phi/(pi*b0)), where the toroidal magnetic field, b0, corresponds to that stored in vacuum_toroidal_field/b0 and pi can be found in the IMAS constants. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within profiles_1d container: Source radial profiles (flux surface averaged quantities) for various time slices. Within grid container: Radial grid.

Normalized poloidal flux coordinate = sqrt((psi(rho)-psi(magnetic_axis)) / (psi(LCFS)-psi(magnetic_axis))). Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within profiles_1d container: Source radial profiles (flux surface averaged quantities) for various time slices. Within grid container: Radial grid.

Poloidal magnetic flux. Integral of magnetic field passing through a contour defined by the intersection of a flux surface passing through the point of interest and a Z=constant plane. If the integration surface is flat, the surface normal vector is in the increasing vertical coordinate direction, Z, namely upwards. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. distribution_sources/source/markers.documentation: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier").

distribution_sources/source/markers/coor.documentation: Set of coordinate identifiers, coordinates on which the markers are represented. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices.

options.name: x
options.description: First cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane

options.name: y
options.description: Second cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane (grad(x) x grad(y) = grad(z))

options.name: rho_tor
options.description: The square root of the toroidal flux, sqrt((Phi-Phi_axis)/pi/B0), where Phi is the toroidal flux and B0 is the vacuum magnetic field

options.name: rho_tor_norm
options.description: The square root of the normalised toroidal flux, sqrt((Phi-Phi_axis)/(Phi_lcf-Phi_axis)), where Phi is the toroidal flux

options.name: rho_pol
options.description: The square root of the poloidal flux, sqrt(psi-psi_axis), where psi is the poloidal flux

options.name: rho_pol_norm
options.description: The square root of the normalised poloidal flux, sqrt((psi-psi_axis)/(psi_lcf-psi_axis)), where psi is the poloidal flux

options.name: theta
options.description: Geometrical poloidal angle around the magnetic axis

options.name: theta_equal_arc
options.description: Equal-arc poloidal angle; a differential of the angle is proportional to the length of the corresponding arc in the poloidal plane.

options.name: velocity
options.description: Total velocity; modulus of the velocity vector

options.name: velocity_phi
options.description: Velocity component in the toroidal direction

options.name: velocity_parallel
options.description: Velocity component parallel to the magnetic field

options.name: velocity_perpendicular
options.description: Velocity perpendicular to the magnetic field

options.name: velocity_thermal
options.description: Velocity normalised to the local thermal velocity of the thermal ions (of the relevant species)

options.name: velocity_radial
options.description: Velocity component in the radial direction

options.name: momentum
options.description: Modulus of the relativistic momentum vector

options.name: momentum_parallel
options.description: Component of the relativistic momentum vector parallel to the magnetic field

options.name: momentum_perpendicular
options.description: Component of the relativistic momentum vector perpendicular to the magnetic field

options.name: energy_hamiltonian
options.description: Hamiltonian energy, including both kinetic and potential energy

options.name: lambda
options.description: Ratio, magnetic moment over hamiltonian energy

options.name: pitch_angle
options.description: Angle between the magnetic field and the velocity vector

options.name: pitch
options.description: Ratio, parallel velocity over total velocity

options.name: pitch_at_min_b
options.description: Pitch, ratio of parallel over perp. velocity, at the minimum value of the magnetic field strength along the guiding centre orbit

options.name: n_phi
options.description: Toroidal mode number, the wave vector toroidal component being defined as k_tor = n_tor grad phi where phi is the toroidal angle so that a positive n_tor means a wave propagating in the positive phi direction

distribution_sources/source/markers/coor.documentation: Short string identifier. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices. Within coordinate_identifier container: Set of coordinate identifiers, coordinates on which the markers are represented.

Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices. Within coordinate_identifier container: Set of coordinate identifiers, coordinates on which the markers are represented.

Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices. Within coordinate_identifier container: Set of coordinate identifiers, coordinates on which the markers are represented.

distribution_sources/source/markers/weig.documentation: Weight of the markers, i.e. number of real particles represented by each marker. The dimension of the vector correspond to the number of markers. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices.

distribution_sources/source/markers/posi.documentation: Position of the markers in the set of coordinates. The first dimension corresponds to the number of markers, the second dimension to the set of coordinates. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices.

distribution_sources/source/markers/orbi.documentation: Integrals along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral (f(n_tor,m_pol,k,eq,...) dt) from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f() a dimensionless function (phase factor,drift,etc) of the equilibrium (e.g. q) and perturbation (Fourier harmonics n_tor,m_pol and bounce harmonic k) along the particles orbits. In fact the integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices.

List of the expressions f(n_tor,m_pol,k,q,...) used in the orbit integrals. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices. Within orbit_integrals container: Integrals along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral (f(n_tor,m_pol,k,eq,...) dt) from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f() a dimensionless function (phase factor,drift,etc) of the equilibrium (e.g. q) and perturbation (Fourier harmonics n_tor,m_pol and bounce harmonic k) along the particles orbits. In fact the integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below.

Array of toroidal mode numbers, where quantities vary as exp(i.n_phi.phi) and phi runs anticlockwise when viewed from above. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices. Within orbit_integrals container: Integrals along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral (f(n_tor,m_pol,k,eq,...) dt) from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f() a dimensionless function (phase factor,drift,etc) of the equilibrium (e.g. q) and perturbation (Fourier harmonics n_tor,m_pol and bounce harmonic k) along the particles orbits. In fact the integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below.

Array of poloidal mode numbers, where quantities vary as exp(-i.m_pol.theta) and theta is the angle defined by the choice of ../../coordinate_identifier, with its centre at the magnetic axis recalled at the root of this IDS. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices. Within orbit_integrals container: Integrals along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral (f(n_tor,m_pol,k,eq,...) dt) from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f() a dimensionless function (phase factor,drift,etc) of the equilibrium (e.g. q) and perturbation (Fourier harmonics n_tor,m_pol and bounce harmonic k) along the particles orbits. In fact the integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below.

Array of bounce harmonics k. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices. Within orbit_integrals container: Integrals along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral (f(n_tor,m_pol,k,eq,...) dt) from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f() a dimensionless function (phase factor,drift,etc) of the equilibrium (e.g. q) and perturbation (Fourier harmonics n_tor,m_pol and bounce harmonic k) along the particles orbits. In fact the integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below.

Values of the orbit integrals. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices. Within orbit_integrals container: Integrals along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral (f(n_tor,m_pol,k,eq,...) dt) from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f() a dimensionless function (phase factor,drift,etc) of the equilibrium (e.g. q) and perturbation (Fourier harmonics n_tor,m_pol and bounce harmonic k) along the particles orbits. In fact the integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below.

Integrals/quantities along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral ( f(eq) dt) from time - tau to time_orbit for different values of time_orbit in the interval from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f(eq) a dimensionless function (phase, drift,q,etc) of the equilibrium along the markers orbits. The integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices.

List of the expressions f(eq) used in the orbit integrals. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices. Within orbit_integrals_instant container: Integrals/quantities along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral ( f(eq) dt) from time - tau to time_orbit for different values of time_orbit in the interval from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f(eq) a dimensionless function (phase, drift,q,etc) of the equilibrium along the markers orbits. The integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below.

Time array along the markers last orbit. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices. Within orbit_integrals_instant container: Integrals/quantities along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral ( f(eq) dt) from time - tau to time_orbit for different values of time_orbit in the interval from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f(eq) a dimensionless function (phase, drift,q,etc) of the equilibrium along the markers orbits. The integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below.

A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices. Within orbit_integrals_instant container: Integrals/quantities along the markers orbit. These dimensionless expressions are of the form: (1/tau) integral ( f(eq) dt) from time - tau to time_orbit for different values of time_orbit in the interval from time - tau to time, where tau is the transit/trapping time of the marker and f(eq) a dimensionless function (phase, drift,q,etc) of the equilibrium along the markers orbits. The integrals are taken during the last orbit of each marker at the time value of the time node below.

distribution_sources/source/markers/toro.documentation: In case the orbit integrals are calculated for a given MHD perturbation, index of the toroidal mode considered. Refers to the time_slice/toroidal_mode array of the MHD_LINEAR IDS in which this perturbation is described. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices.

distribution_sources/source/markers/time.documentation: Time. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within source container: Set of source/sink terms. A source/sink term corresponds to the particle source due to an NBI injection unit, a nuclear reaction or any combination of them (described in "identifier"). Within markers container: Source given as a group of markers (test particles) born per second, for various time slices.

distribution_sources/vacuum_toroidal_fie.documentation: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in rho_tor definition). Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions.

Reference major radius where the vacuum toroidal magnetic field is given (usually a fixed position such as the middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane). Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within vacuum_toroidal_field container: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in rho_tor definition).

Vacuum toroidal field at R0 [T]; Positive sign means anti-clockwise when viewing from above. The product R0B0 must be consistent with the b_tor_vacuum_r field of the tf IDS. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within vacuum_toroidal_field container: Characteristics of the vacuum toroidal field (used in rho_tor definition).

distribution_sources/magnetic_axis.documentation: Magnetic axis position (used to define a poloidal angle for the 2D profiles). Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions.

distribution_sources/magnetic_axis/r.documentation: Major radius. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within magnetic_axis container: Magnetic axis position (used to define a poloidal angle for the 2D profiles).

distribution_sources/magnetic_axis/z.documentation: Height. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Within magnetic_axis container: Magnetic axis position (used to define a poloidal angle for the 2D profiles).

distribution_sources/time.documentation: Generic time. Within distribution_sources IDS: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions.
